We study the effects of applying a Fourier transform on the temperature distribution, denoted as \\(\\mathcal{F}(T)\\), and analyze its influence over time.

Can we determine exactly which transformations were applied (whether \\(\\mathcal{F}(T)\\), \\(\\mathcal{G}(T)\\), or both) just by observing the final state \\(\\mathcal{F}(T)(T)\\)?

Distinguishing whether the initial state was transformed by \\(\\mathcal{F}(T)\\), only to be later modified by \\(\\mathcal{G}(T)\\), or some other sequence, is ambiguous without additional information due to overlapping effects in the transformed domain.
